definition: to correct/to amend/to put right/correction/CL:個|个[ge4]
to change/to alter/to transform/to correct
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

sentences.english: those who do not make the corrections within the time limit, shall be ordered to stop construction, and can be imposed with penalty simultaneously.
sentences.chinese: 逾期不改正的，责令停止施工，可以并处罚款。

sentences.english: Mr. A has righted the scandals in his office.
sentences.chinese: 先生的办公室丑闻，已经改正过来。

sentences.english: An end group correction factor was introduced for getting the true weight distribution of chain length.
sentences.chinese: 引进了一个端基改正因子以获得真实的重量链长分布。

sentences.english: I've had all my mistakes corrected.
sentences.chinese: 我已把所有的错误都改正过来了。

sentences.english: The young worker found a lot of shortcomings in himself and he set about getting rid of it.
sentences.chinese: 那位青年工人发现身上有不少缺点，就着手进行改正。

sentences.english: You have the time to correct some of the problems.
sentences.chinese: 你还有大把的时间可以改正错误。

sentences.english: After you finish the test, go over it and correct your mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 答完试题仔细检查一下，把错的改正过来。

sentences.english: He longs for them to adjust their behaviour to reflect the righteousness of Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 他切望他们能够改正行为以彰显出耶稣的公义。

sentences.english: Look at where you lost points and fix it.
sentences.chinese: 看看你失分的地方并改正它。

sentences.english: No rectification or redress is due to a player who acts on the basis of his own misunderstanding.
sentences.chinese: 牌手因本身误解作出的叫牌，无权提出修正或改正。

sentences.english: These were examples of faulty English that we were called upon to correct.
sentences.chinese: 它们是要求我们改正的英语病句的例子。

sentences.english: A fault confessed is half redressed.
sentences.chinese: 承认错误，等于改正一半。

sentences.english: We hope she'll come to her senses and correct her mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望她能觉悟过来，改正错误。

sentences.english: Simply correcting your mistake and moving on may not be an option.
sentences.chinese: 仅仅改正错误然后继续向前可能并不现实。

sentences.english: You should rectify your error before it is too late.
sentences.chinese: 你应当及时改正你的错误。

definition: to correct/to make right
error/mistake/CL:個|个[ge4]/mistaken/false/wrong
to drop a bad habit
to examine or inspect/self-criticism/review
to reflect upon oneself/to examine one's conscience/to question oneself/to search one's soul
to correct/to make a correction
to repeat a crime/persistent offender
to draw a lesson (from a setback)
to supervise and urge completion of a task/to urge on
to recognize one's mistakes and be able to reform oneself (idiom)
correct any mistakes you made, but maintain your good record if you did not make them (idiom)
pinyin: you3 ze2 gai3 zhi1 , wu2 ze2 jia1 mian3

definition: to err/to make a mistake/to do the wrong thing
to point out mistakes or weak points for correction/to comment/criticism
lit. not to change, despite repeated admonition/incorrigible/unrepentant
error/fault/(law) negligence/delinquency
to correct an error
